item.title: Lateral Gaze Lesions.pdf
item.itunes:subtitle: Februeary 14, 2009 - Happy Valentine's Day! - Use this illustrations of lesions in conjunction with my CNS Atlas Plate 34 to study the lateral gaze system & lesions in various components of the system.

item.title: Limbic System Podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: 3/16/09 Limbic System All of the components of the limbic system are outlined, with stress on the structure & function of the amygdala and hippocampus. The Kluver-Bucy & Korsokoff Syndromes are discussed. The connections of the Papez Circuit are reviewed.
item.description: 3/16/09 Limbic System All of the components of the limbic system are outlined, with stress on the structure & function of the amygdala and hippocampus. The Kluver-Bucy & Korsokoff Syndromes are discussed. The connections of the Papez Circuit are reviewed.
item.author: rclark2@med.miami.edu
item.itunes:author: Dr. Ronald Clark

item.title: Clark Neuro Review.swf
item.itunes:subtitle: Interactive review of key areas in neuroanatomy. To play this program, download the free Adobe Flash Player at www.adobe.com. Then, open my progrm in your browser (Explorer, Safari,Firefox).

item.title: First Lesion Localization.ppt
item.itunes:subtitle: This is our first lesion localization problem solving exercise in neuroanatomy to be completed by noon on Friday, February 15, 2008.
item.itunes:summary: First lesion localization exercise in neuroanatomy from Dr Ron Clark. Work in teams a diagram 5 lesions to account for the symptoms in 5 cases. Form teams of 4 to 6 members. Solutions due by noon on Friday, February 15, 2008.
item.description: This is our first lesion localization problem solving exercise in neuroanatomy to be completed by noon on Friday, February 15, 2008.
item.author: rclark2@med.miami.edu
item.itunes:author: Dr. Ronald Clark

item.title: Brain Stem Introduction Podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: This is a self-instructional podcast. Brief introduction to the brain stem, including: midbrain, pons, and medulla. Posterior, anterior, and midsagittal views, along with axial sections and MRIs.
item.itunes:summary: Brief introduction to the brain stem, including: midbrain, pons, and medulla. Posterior, anterior, and midsagittal views, along with axial sections and MRIs.
